channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Some kids still have Covid-19 symptoms, months after falling ill
item.description: Fourteen-year-old Indiana Evans is a promising dancer from Hertfordshire, southern England, who was doing 16 hours of practice a week on top of school before the coronavirus pandemic hit.

item.title: How New Zealand went 100 days with no community Covid-19 transmission
item.description: New Zealand has marked an enviable milestone -- more than 100 days since its last coronavirus case was acquired locally from an unknown source.

item.title: CNN anchor to Trump supporter on Covid-19: What you're saying is unscientific
item.description: CNN's Boris Sanchez had a spirited exchange with Bikers for Trump Founder Chris Cox over his claims on the coronavirus pandemic and its origins.

item.title: Trump's big power move leaves workers in limbo
item.description: • Analysis: The final Biden VP rankings • Opinion: Biden just destroyed one of Trump's biggest attack lines

item.title: A record number of people are giving up their US citizenship, according to new research. Here's why
item.description: A record number of people are giving up their US citizenship, new research published on Sunday found.

item.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy media tycoon arrested under new national security law
item.description: A Hong Kong media tycoon known for his support of the city's pro-democracy movement and criticism of China has been arrested under the new security law imposed on the city last month, which bans "collusion with foreign forces."

item.title: Fareed: Trump's internet initiatives starting to look like China's
item.description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria gives his take on the Trump administration's plan to ban almost all Chinese IT products, including the popular video application TikTok, if it stays in Chinese hands.

item.title: Monsoon rains trigger tea plantation landslide killing at least 43
item.description: At least 43 people, including three children, have died with dozens more feared buried after torrential rains triggered a landslide in the southwestern Indian state of Kerala.

item.title: Esper appears to backtrack on Beirut explosion cause after White House pushback
item.description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper is downplaying any differences he had with the White House's assessment as to what caused the deadly explosion in Beirut after his speculation that the blast was likely the result of an accident drew push back from the White House.

item.title: Europe's biggest countries are seeing Covid surges -- but not this one
item.description: A horrifying moment in the Covid-19 pandemic hit Italy on March 27, 2020, when the civil protection authorities announced that 969 people had died in just 24 hours. In the weeks before that, images of coffins stacked up in church parlors and being driven down the streets of the northern Italian town of Bergamo in a caravan of military trucks poured into the homes of Italians, by then locked down for nearly three weeks.

item.title: Protests in Belarus as disputed early election results give President overwhelming victory
item.description: Protests erupted across Belarus late Sunday after disputed preliminary results showed a landslide election victory for longtime President Alexander Lukashenko.

item.title: Joe Biden just destroyed one of Trump's biggest attack lines
item.description: Joe Biden on Saturday utterly devastated one of President Donald Trump's most repeated attack lines against the former Vice President. And the irony is Fox News helped him do it.

item.title: CNN's analyst breaks down the latest 2020 polls
item.description: CNN's senior political writer and analyst Harry Enten looks over brand new polls that show Joe Biden holding his lead over President Trump as the presidential election gets closer.

item.title: US surpasses 5 million Covid-19 cases
Democratic women leaders call out sexist news coverage of female vice presidential candidates
item.description: A group of Democratic women leaders is calling out sexist coverage of female Democratic vice presidential contenders — and they're asking that newsrooms to do better.

item.title: Teen who shared photo of packed high school hallway says she's receiving threats
item.description: A teen who shared a photo of a crowded hallway at her Georgia high school last week says she has been receiving threats after the image went viral.

item.title: Why Bill Gates thinks the American coronavirus testing system is not improving
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates discusses why the US is still struggling to contain the spread of the coronavirus. Two of the main issues, he says, are a failure to shut down and a lag in testing capabilities.

item.title: Top US health official meets with Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen in highest-level summit for decades
item.description: Alex Azar, the United States Health and Human Services secretary, met with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen Monday, the highest-level meeting between Washington and the self-ruled island in decades.

item.title: Afghanistan to release 400 Taliban prisoners, paving way for direct peace talks
item.description: The Afghan government has agreed to release 400 Taliban prisoners, paving the way for direct peace talks with the insurgent group to end nearly two decades of war.

item.title: One of India's biggest food delivery companies introduces period leave
item.description: One of India's biggest food delivery companies says it will give all female employees 10 days of "period leave" a year — a significant milestone in a country where menstruation remains a taboo topic.

item.title: See the site of the explosion in Beirut now
item.description: CNN's Arwa Damon is in Beirut, Lebanon, where rescue crews are undertaking a bleak search for missing persons and beginning the long cleanup process after a massive explosion devastated the city.

item.title: This is what distance learning should look like in the fall
item.description: When Kim Reeder started teaching in Parker, Colorado, 14 years ago, she found that managing the classroom environment took way more time and energy than actually teaching kids, and she couldn't reach as many of them as she wanted.

item.title: Flooding is bad news for the world's second-largest economy
US golf star Collin Morikawa, 23, wins maiden major at the PGA Championship
item.description: It will go down as one of those 'where were you when' moments. Where were you when Collin Morikawa struck what will surely become known as one of the greatest shots in golf history on his way to a first major title at the age of just 23?

item.title: Former WWE wrestler James 'Kamala' Harris dies at 70
item.description: Former WWE wrestler James Harris has died at age 70, according to a news release from the wrestling company.

item.title: Twins lose it while listening to Phil Collins song for first time
item.description: A video of twin brothers Tim and Fred Williams listening to Phil Collins' 1981 debut single "In the Air Tonight" for the first time is lighting up the internet. CNN's Christi Paul and Victor Blackwell have more.

item.title: Puerto Rico voting temporarily halted amid lack of ballots
item.description: Puerto Rico's primary elections were temporarily halted Sunday because of a lack of ballots in voting centers across the island, according to election officials.

item.title: Trump shut down briefing after he's fact-checked by reporter
item.description: When fact-checked by a reporter about his false claim that he signed into law the Veterans Choice bill, President Donald Trump swiftly ended a news conference with reporters. CNN's Daniel Dale has more.

item.title: This New Zealand city has an official wizard
item.description: On a sunny autumn afternoon, two wizards in long, black robes and pointed hats sat down for coffee in one of New Zealand's biggest cities.

item.title: Dr. Gupta answers children's Covid-19 questions
item.description: CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers children's coronavirus questions sent from around the country.

item.title: The foreign threats to the US election
item.description: Foreign actors still view US politics as a playpen. That's the key takeaway from the updated assessment of the election threat landscape by the US intelligence community's top election security official. It included detailed information on the "the intentions and activities" of China, Russia and Iran with respect to the 2020 election, now less than three months away.

item.title: How to fact-check Donald Trump in realtime
item.description: Two recent interviews with President Donald Trump, one on Axios on HBO and another on Fox News Sunday, provide a lesson on how to fact-check the President in realtime. CNN's Daniel Dale breaks it down.

item.title: These are the twins whose first-time reaction to hearing Phil Collins has captured the internet
item.description: The almost eight-minute long video begins with Tim Williams and his twin brother, Fred, sitting side by side.

item.title: Modules of 56-story skyscrapers to be built in Malaysia, stacked in Singapore
Verstappen shocks Mercedes duo to win GP
item.description: Max Verstappen stunned the Mercedes duo of world champion Lewis Hamilton and pole sitter Valtteri Bottas to claim victory in the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix at Silverstone on Sunday.

item.title: See large chunk of glacier at risk of falling
item.description: Dozens of people have been evacuated from a valley in northern Italy amid fears that a section of ice the size of a football field could collapse from a glacier.

item.title: What we can learn from Covid-19 for the climate crisis
item.description: CNN's Bill Weir explores what we can learn from Covid-19 to better prepare for the impact of the climate crisis.

item.title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway earnings jumped 87% as it recovers from the pandemic
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway is recovering from a rough start to a year in which it was hard hit by the coronavirus. Its second quarter earnings, released Saturday morning, were up almost 87% from last year, and a big turnaround from its huge first quarter loss.

item.title: Searching for the oldest pub in the world
item.description: We ricocheted all over Europe on a quest to grab a pint at the oldest pub in the world. Trying to pin down which pub deserved that title, however, proved to be a little trickier than expected. From Nottingham, England, to Athlone, Ireland, watering holes all over Europe claim to have been pulling pints long before anyone else. Will we find the answers we're looking for? Will one pint reign supreme? Maybe, but one thing's for sure, this has got to be the best excuse for a pub crawl there is. Cheers!

item.title: A retirement community shoots for 1,006 cards for a woman turning 106
item.description: 106 cards for 106 years of life.

item.title: What breakfast is like around the world
item.description: Typically eat eggs, or a bowl of cereal for breakfast? There are so many other tasty options. In this episode of "Around the World," Great Big Story senior producer Beryl Shereshewsky makes wake-up calls to seven people in seven countries to find out what they eat to start the day. Among the dishes featured: Vietnam's súp lu'o'n, a spicy eel soup; mandazi, an airy deep-fried dough from Kenya; and a plate of scrumptious catfish and grits made to perfection in the United States.

item.title: A police dog found a missing mom and her baby during his first shift on the force
item.description: A missing mother and her 1-year-old baby were found after a very good boy named Max discovered them on the edge of a ravine.

item.title: Why Michelle Obama opening up about depression is a big deal for Black women
item.description: Michelle Obama recently revealed that because of the pandemic and racial injustice in the US, she has been experiencing low-grade depression.

item.title: This school reopened and one child infected 25 teachers
item.description: During the first few months of the pandemic, Israel was praised for its response to the coronavirus but after the country reopened its schools, it has seen a surge in outbreaks. CNN's Elliott Gotkine reports.

item.title: More than 97,000 US kids tested positive in last two weeks of July
item.description: More than 97,000 children in the US tested positive for coronavirus in the last two weeks of July, a new report says.

item.title: Indian regional health minister tests positive for Covid-19
This is what it's like for family of the missing in Beirut
item.description: Michelle hasn't slept for three nights. Her husband Joe worked at the Beirut port but she hasn't heard from him since the blast. CNN's Arwa Damon meets Michelle, her two small daughters and a family fearing the worst.

item.title: 'Unprecedented' protests erupt in Belarus
item.description: Protests erupted across Belarus following a presidential election as preliminary results showed President Alexander Lukashenko re-elected with 80% of the vote, according to the country's Central Election Commission. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports.

item.title: Australia's oldest micronation is no more thanks to Covid-19
item.description: The 50-year reign of an Australia-based micronation formed by a "prince" has come to an end.

item.title: Baby among 7 hurt after car crashes into horse and buggy
item.description: A 7-month-old baby and six other people were taken to the hospital with various injuries after a car struck a Mennonite horse and buggy in the Finger Lakes region of New York state Sunday.
